Race.SpecificTitle: PW Consolidated School District Prop. No. 1 of 2 -- $64M Bond - SB - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Consolidated School District Proposition No. 1 of 2
(Bonds)
Race.FullText: Shall the Consolidated School District of the Parish of St. James, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding $64,000,000, in one or more series, to run not exceeding 25 years from date thereof, with interest not exceeding 6% per annum, for the purpose of refunding all or a portion of the outstanding General Obligation Bonds of the District, said bonds having been issued for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks, parking lots, and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, constructing and/or improving school buildings and/or athletic and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor; which bonds will be general obligations of the District payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected as provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated millage rate to be levied in the first year of 6.6 mills, being a decrease of 3.4 mills over the amount currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Consolidated School District Prop. No. 2 of 2 -- 3.40 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Consolidated School District Proposition No. 2 of 2
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall the Consolidated School District of the Parish of St. James, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy a special tax of three and four tenths (3.40) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $1,750,000.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the year 2021 and ending in the year 2030, for the purpose of giving additional support to the public schools in the District?
